bibdata.title: Reindex production so that Change the Subject and indigenous studies terms are applied

comments.body: This is done. See discussion in https://pulibrary.slack.com/archives/CA891BNR0/p1634582061499700

Reviewed with @mzelesky 
An example of a holdings_1display would be:

"holdings_1display": 
"{ "22745884920006421\":
{\"location_code\":\"lewis$stacks\",\"location\":\"Stacks\",\"library\":\"Lewis Library\",\"call_number\":\"QB981 . D63 2021\",\"call_number_browse\":\"QB981 . D63 2021\",\"items\":[{\"holding_id\":\"22745884920006421\",\"id\":\"23745884910006421\",\"status_at_load\":\"1\",\"barcode\":\"32101104014996\",\"copy_number\":\"0\"}]},
"lewis$res":
{\"location_code\":\"lewis$res\",\"location\":\"Course Reserve\",\"library\":\"Lewis Library\",\"call_number\":\"QB981 . D63 2021\",\"call_number_browse\":\"QB981 . D63 2021\", \"items\":[{\"holding_id\":\"22745884920006421\",\"id\":\"23898873500006421\",\"status_at_load\":\"1\",\"barcode\":\"32101109060713\",\"copy_number\":\"2\"}]}
}"

Items will be grouped by the temporary location. Temporary location will be added as an extra key in the holdings_1display key. Items grouped under the temporary location could have different holding ids. 

This will also assist to fix: https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/issues/2751 and https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1616

comments.body: @kelea99 I'm not entirely clear on what the issue is here. Is the problem that the "Limit Your Search" facets are not lining up with the button containers?

Have a look at line height. When sub title is used  for collection, current format cuts off lower bits of letters of the title and/or subtitle when card content expands upward when you hover.  Affected Collections:
1. Piranesi
2. Building Exhibits in DPUL
3. Badakhshan
4. Ho! for the open country
5. PUL library oof islamic MSS
6. Picturesque
The lower bits of letters problem appears to happen only when logged in
I will ensure I run tests on everything signed out and signed in going forward. thank you, @hackartisan !

dpul.title: Spanish labels are displaying for page navbar even when set to english

comments.body: so when i look at it it's always english regardless of what I set it to. spanish translations appear to be present when i look in the dashboard.
@kelea99 was there a data change? Do we still have this issue?
Yes, we still have this issue: https://dpul-staging.princeton.edu/chilean_photographs/home?locale=es
@kelea99 to clarify, the issue as originally says that Spanish displays even when set to English. Is that what you see?

@hackartisan  No. I only see english when I restored the defaults to english in the Dashboard =>Appearance=>main menu section.  Anything changed there reflects in the menu, regardless of what language is selected and what may or may not be in the translations manually given in the dashboard=>translations section.
This is fixed.

dspace-development.title: Elevate permissions for pnobles so she can edit metadata
Document how to remove an object's collection reference

comments.body: Load the JRuby terminal: ``` $ source $HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm $ cd ~/pulibrary-src/dspace-cli $ bin/dspace-irb $eperson Using /dspace Loading jars Loading /dspace/config/dspace.cfg INFO: Loading provided config file: /dspace/config/dspace.cfg INFO: Using dspace provided log configuration (log.init.config) INFO: Loading: /dspace/config/log4j.properties Starting new DSpaceKernel DB jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/dspace_db, UserName=dspace_db_user, PostgreSQL JDBC Driver jruby-9.2.13.0 :001 > ``` In the JRuby terminal: ``` query = DSpace::CLI::Query.new # handle of the object to be updated query.find_by_handle('88435/dsp010k225f00b') first_item = query.results.first # handle of the collection_handle = '88435/dsp01c247ds15b' collection = DSpace::CLI::SeniorThesisCollection.find_for_handle(collection_handle) collection.removeItem(first_item) collection.index ``` ### Before running this code: --- ### After running this code: --- ### Another item in this collection with the collection reference remaining after this code has been executed: ---

dspace-development.title: Map 2021 Senior Thesis items from certificate programs to their DataSpace collections.

comments.body:
As stated in the linked issue from 2020, the following action run on the server and then at the dspace CLI prompt resolves this issue:

Load the JRuby terminal:
```
$ source $HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm
$ cd ~/pulibrary-src/dspace-cli
$ bin/dspace-irb $eperson
  Using /dspace
  Loading jars
  Loading /dspace/config/dspace.cfg
  INFO: Loading provided config file: /dspace/config/dspace.cfg
  INFO: Using dspace provided log configuration (log.init.config)
  INFO: Loading: /dspace/config/log4j.properties
  Starting new DSpaceKernel
  DB jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/dspace_db, UserName=dspace_db_user,
  PostgreSQL JDBC Driver
  jruby-9.2.13.0 :001 >

```

In the JRuby terminal: 
```
cert_handle = '88435/dsp01c247ds15b'
cert_collection = DSpace::CLI::SeniorThesisCollection.find_for_handle(cert_handle)
query = DSpace::CLI::SeniorThesisCommunity.find_by_class_year('2021')

cert_program = 'Theater Program'
sub_query = query.find_by_certificate_program(cert_program)

items = []
sub_query.results.each do |item|
  add_to_collection = true
  item.collections.each do |ic|
    add_me = false if ic.handle == "88435/dsp01c247ds15b"
  end
  items << item if add_to_collection
end

items.each do |i|
  cert_collection.add_item(i)
  cert_collection.update
end 

cert_collection.index
```
Where `cert_handle` is the certificate program ark to be mapped (consult the table above), the matching `pu.certificate` value from the item's metadata (for example `Theater Program`, `Creative Writing Program`), and the parameter in the call to `find_by_class_year` matching the current year.

I ran this code against the following item, after adjusting the class year to 2021, and adding a `pu.certificate` field instance with the value `Theater Program`: 
https://dataspace-dev.princeton.edu/handle/99999/fk4321d72q

I also adjusted the following item on staging (imported in 2020) to be in the class year 2021, with the `pu.certificate` value of `Theater Program.`:
https://dataspace-staging.princeton.edu/handle/88435/dsp01xw42nb94p

We should be safe to run this on production ASAP.

~~There is a bug in the JRuby code above that will repeatedly add the certificate collection value to the collection field whenever it is executed.  I am looking into fixing this bug now;~~ 

The above-mentioned but has been resolved in the code sample above.  It is verbose but explicit and does not add duplicate collection values.

In the future we should figure out the best way to remove an item from a collection, which is not possible in the web UI or CLI in this version of DSpace (see #505).

dspace-development.title: Ensure that top-level folders in Globus display the correct dates
Migrate more large datasets to Globus

comments.body: Larger files (usually 1.5 GB) timeout when we attempt to download them from the DataSpace front end, so we need someone with direct access to the bitstreams to help us transfer them to the Globus endpoint.

These entries should now be importing as expected: ![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5b5b6aed981c3204c9ed06c8/f5ca7259-f447-48d9-9aff-9c84e656afb6)

pul_solr.title: solr backups not running on solr7 production

comments.body:
@tpendragon investigated, backups are failing on Solr 2/3 because the mounted drive for backups is not owned by the correct user.

All three Solr servers should be capable of running the backups as the leader of the cluster. Fix the current mounting system:
- [x] mount diglibdata1 only once, as `/mnt/solr_backup`
- [ ] use NFS instead of CIFS
- [x] ensure the owner of the `/mnt/solr_backup` directory is the local `deploy` user, which may have a different UID on each box
- [x] update `/etc/fstab` so the new configuration will survive a reboot

I've got 3 of 4 tasks done. I'll wait until we've had a successful backup or two before I try to change the mount from CIFS to NFS. This way if we'll have an easier time determining the cause of any problems we see.
@tpendragon This should have been fixed with PR #618 back in January. I will reach out to John to see if he can demo this or provide a GIF.

symplectic-elements-utils.title: Introduces the updates needed to more effectively up the HR user imports for Symplectic Elements
